name: Dr. Christian Bird
title: Senior Principal Researcher
bio: Dr. Christian Bird is a Senior Principal Researcher at Microsoft Research, where he studies software engineering practices, developer productivity, and the intersection of AI and software development. His work combines empirical software engineering, large-scale data analysis, and human factors to understand how developers work and how tools can better support them.
about: Christian's research focuses on understanding and improving software development processes through empirical studies of real-world development practices. He has published extensively on topics including code review, branching strategies, testing practices, and more recently, AI-assisted programming. His work bridges academic research and industrial practice, often using data from large-scale software projects to inform both tool design and process improvements.

current_projects.title: AI-Assisted Development
current_projects.description: Investigating how developers work with AI coding assistants, examining trust, adoption patterns, and the evolution of programming practices in the age of generative AI.

current_projects.title: Developer Productivity & Experience
current_projects.description: Understanding what makes developers productive and satisfied, developing metrics and tools to measure and improve developer experience across large organizations.

current_projects.title: Software Engineering at Scale
current_projects.description: Studying practices and challenges in large-scale software development, including code review, testing, continuous integration, and collaborative workflows.
